ThingDef.label: human Implant: bear claws
ThingDef.description: An improvement over the bionic Power Claw, these claws have been vat-grown with a mixture of human and bear DNA, and replace the subject's hand with versatile, non-retractable claws.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: digging bear claws
ThingDef.description: Grotesque but powerful hand blades that have been modified to be used in mining operations, increasing both speed and yield.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: bear muscle tissue
ThingDef.description: Grafts of bear muscle tissue on the subject's torso increase overall strength and stamina. These grafts however tend to stimulate the production of an abundance of body hair.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: hibernation module
ThingDef.description: A biochip that modifies the brain to reduce the need for sleep.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: ovipositor
ThingDef.description: You know you have gone too far in your scientific experiments when you are implanting a human being with an ovipositor. This will enable the colonist to lay chicken eggs twice a day. It hurts as hell, though. Also, yuck.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: muffalo strengthened muscles
ThingDef.description: By weaving muffalo muscle strands with the subjects muscular system, strength, resilience and carrying capacity are greatly increased.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: muffalo mammaries
ThingDef.description: By implanting muffalo mammaries into a colonist... Wait, what??? Who came up with this idea????? Anyway... this implant allows your colonist to be milked... Ugh, I give up.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: muffalo skin
ThingDef.description: A synthetic skin substitute that is much thicker and a much better insulator than human skin. This provides a measure of defense but, more importantly, makes the subject more resistant to low temperatures.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: boomalope nodules
ThingDef.description: These skin nodules can be integrated in a human's torso, causing a huge explosion if the subjects dies violently.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: chemfuel stomach
ThingDef.description: A reinforced bionic stomach that uses a combination of gastric acid and chemfuel to efficiently digest food.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: chemfuel heart
ThingDef.description: A reinforced bionic heart that acts like a miniature 4-stroke internal combustion engine powered by chemfuel to pump blood through the body.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: wolf muscular fibers
ThingDef.description: The subjects legs can be modified by weaving hybrid human/wolf muscle fibers within the base tissue, giving her a significant strength and speed boost.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: devouring jaws
ThingDef.description: A set of improved teeth designed to rapidly chew and ingest any kind of food. Leaves kind of a mess, though...

ThingDef.label: human Implant: neuron reinforcement
ThingDef.description: A biochip using animal stem cells to reinforce the natural abilities of human neurons, increasing learning and research speed.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: mouse pheromones
ThingDef.description: A bionic vomeronasal organ that allows the subject pheromonal communication with other animals, increasing the chance of taming and training them successfully.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: mole-rat nerve dampener
ThingDef.description: A biochip that reduces pain sensitivity, allowing the subject to survive pain shock.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: bunny ear
ThingDef.description: This huge leporid ear gives amazing enhanced hearing. Also, super kawaii!

ThingDef.label: human Implant: insectoid antennae
ThingDef.description: These hybrid humanoid / insectoid feeling appendages can be implanted in a subject's head, completely modifying the way the subject "sees" and feels the surrounding world. The experience may be slightly overwhelming due to sensorial overload.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: compund eye
ThingDef.description: This hybrid humanoid / insectoid eye provides improved vision in a wide range of different wavelengths, including those usually outside the human range, completely modifying the way the subject perceives his surroundings.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: psychic dampeners
ThingDef.description: Artificial hearing aids that block psychic emanations, providing considerable resistance to mechanoids' psychic attacks.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: kidney toxic filters
ThingDef.description: This is a bioelectronic kidney prosthesis that greatly improves the efficiency of the subject's kidney by using insectoid tissue, providing resistence to toxic substances.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: thrumbo horn
ThingDef.description: A genetically modified thrumbo horn that can be implanted in a subject's forehead. Nasty.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: thrumbo skin
ThingDef.description: A synthetic skin substitute that is much thicker and a much better insulator than human skin. This provides a lot of defense and makes the subject more resistant to extremes of temperature.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: venomous fangs
ThingDef.description: This hybrid implant substitutes the subject's jaw with a set of venomous fangs. Useful in combat, but not very comfortable.

ThingDef.label: human Implant: iguana scales
ThingDef.description: A synthetic skin substitute that is much thicker and a much better insulator than human skin. This provides a measure of defense but, more importantly, makes the subject more resistant to high temperatures.
